intro: Phyllotrichum mekongense, commonly known as the Mekong spikerush, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the wetland ecosystems in its native range.
